intro: Euryops indecorus, commonly known as the yellow daisy or African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
